duties_responsibilities.duty: Strategic oversight and management of procurement process, including strategic sourcing, procurement, vendor relationship management, and contract negotiation, payments, e-procurement, and shipping and receiving.
Establish and implement short- and long-range organizational goals, strategic plans, policies, and operating procedures.
Develop organizational capabilities; build and manage an effective, professional, and diverse procurement team.
Develop and execute strategic sourcing initiatives, establish targets of cost savings, and determine financial impacts.
Review major procurement contracts; coordinate contract compliance, change orders, and problem resolution.
Oversee the vendor selection process, assessment of vendor capabilities, and evaluation of vendor performance.
Direct and oversee the management of the operations of Accounts Payable and Shipping and Receiving functions.
Maintain compliance with internal college policies and appropriate regulatory procurement regulations.
Develop and maintain internal procurement policies and rules that balance best business practices, compliance, customer needs, and flexibility.
Plan, develop, and implement strategies for generating resources and/or revenues for the organization.
Perform periodic cost and productivity analyses; acts as negotiator between the College and vendors/suppliers on procurement contracts.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration required; MBA preferred; Advanced certification (CPPO or CPM) is highly desired.
